deck: Graphic artist, wordsmith & comic book maker. He has worked as comic book colorista for Rovolt, IDW Publishing, Stone Arch & Moonstone Books, for titles and characters as The Phantom, Aveon 9, Buckaroo Banzai, Dungeons & Dragons, The Heap and more. Currently works as colorist and, sometimes, as letterer for Zenescope.

deck: RICHARD POWERS is a Hugo Award winner who had painted more than 1,500 covers for science fiction paperbacks. Powers’ trailblazing style, a combination of heightened realism and spaced-out “special effects," was like a sci-fi version of DC's Vertigo line.

description:
Digikore Studios is one of the largest professional setups in the World offering services in Penciling, Inking, Coloring and Lettering. We work with some of the largest publishers in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, France, Denmark and Holland on their comics.

Apart from great pricing we are known for our quality and on time delivery. Do feel free to contact us at abhishek@digikore.com

description:
Career

Raul Barbéro begane working in comics in the early 1980s when he joined the Jaime Diaz Studio. He worked for Disney through the 1990s, inking for Aladdin, Duck Tales, Rescue Rangers, and TaleSpin among others. Sometime after 1995 he became affiliated with Branca Studios. 

Personal Life

Raul Barbéro was born c.1954 in Argentina.
name: Raul Barbéro

deck: François Bourgeon. (born 1945, Paris) is a French comics artist, author of several noted European comic books.

deck: Editor at IDW, and formerly for DC Comics.
name: Sarah Gaydos

deck: Bentti Bisson is the penciller,inker and co-creator of the Terragoth Chronicles series published by DQU Comics (Dual Quest Unlimited).
description:
Bentti Bisson began his comics career in early 2007 by creating the fantasy series, the Terragoth Chronicles. With the help of writer, Lonnie Pittman, the two have released 3 issues in the series so far, and intend to finish the long running series at aproximately 30-40 issues. The third issue of the series was postponed when Bentti Bisson's wife had a baby. He took 5 months from the comics to take care of his new family. When Bentti came back to work, he decided that the third issue needed to have color interiors from then on. He sought the help of artist, Myrton Bewry to color the book. Myrton has teamed with Bentti to create a series of posters and art pieces depicting subjects from the Terragoth Chronicles.
Bentti and DQU COMICS co-founder, Lonnie Pittman have yet to use professional distributors and marketing companies to help with the Terragoth Chronicles. The two creators and their wives have sought the help of various review sites on the internet and are touring the comic conventions with hopes of developing a larger reader base. Their contact with retailers has been through phone sales and free promo kits mailed to comic stores. 

Aside from the Terragoth Chronicles series, Bentti is working on a detective/mystery comic mini-series which will be released through DQU Comics. Lonnie Pittman will be writing a mini-series based on other aspects of the world of Terragoth, probably on another timeline from the original series.
name: Bentti Bisson

deck: Lonnie Pittman is the writer and co-creator of the Terragoth Chronicles series. Lonnie has a novelist approach to writing, which makes it interesting to read his comic book work.
description:
Through many years of interest in the medieval-fantasy genre, Lonnie Pittman met with childhood friend, Bentti Bisson to create a story, setting, and a set of characters that would come to make up the world of Terragoth. Lonnie and Bentti had always played role-playing games, both the pen-and-paper as well as the video game type. Their desire to create and customize characters and stories led to the development of a comic book series that was intended to be their ideal medieval RPG scenario. Lonnie Pittman wrote the Terragoth Chronicles in much the same way he might write a full novel, with extensive details and backstories based on it's subjects. The original writing was not written in the traditional comic book script format, rather, it reads exactly like a book. Before the comic pages are illustrated, Lonnie and Bentti reformat the story to include the most important details in order to keep the pacing up to comic book standards, this is done in the same way one might create an adaptation of a book to film.


Lonnie Pittman has written a number of poems, some have even seen publication. He grew up writing horror stories and fantasy fiction and is interested in eventually creating scripts for video games.
The Terragoth Chronicles is his first foray into the world of comic books, and Lonnie is said to have developed a great fondness of the genre. He is currently working on future issues of the original series as well as some other titles that exist within the world of Terragoth, yet don't involve the heroes from the original series.
name: Lonnie Pittman

deck: Creator of the Star Wars Universe, and most of the best known Star Wars characters currently appearing in the Dark Horse titles.
description: George Lucas is a writer/director who has been involved in numerous projects, most notably the Star Wars and Indiana Jones films. His creations have had success in various media, including comic books and graphic novels, especially in the case of the Star Wars characters who have held numerous titles in Marvel and Dark Horse. Much of the current media of Star Wars, both in the video games, cartoons, and comics ultimately is still approved by George before it ever is seen by the public. Such is the case of The Force Unleashed, as well as Lucas specifically asking Dark Horse writers not to kill off certain characters in the comics, who George Lucas obviously has plans for in the future.
name: George Lucas

His work has appeared in comics such as Hellboy, Stormwatch: PHD, Mirror's Edge, The Unknown, Doctor Who, etc.

deck: Artist of Sonic the Hedgehog.  A brilliant under-stated artist.  Attended SCAD (Savannah College of Art and Design in Savannah, Georgia).
description:
Tracy Yardley is a long time artist of the comic series Sonic the Hedgehog, Sonic universe, and Sonic X, all published by Archie comics. He has been known to work on the Sonic the Hedgehog series since 2005-current time. he is also currently the main artist of Sonic Universe.

A brilliant technical artist. When it comes to storyboarding, layouts and angles, Tracy is a master. His work looks very fluent and effortless in the best way possible!

Tracy also worked at Universal Studios Florida as a caricature artist for a brief time early in his career. Tracy also attended the Savannah College of Art and Design.

Currently resides with his wife in Savannah, Georgia.

http://tracyyardley.com/
name: Tracy Yardley

deck: An artist known for his famous friend, filmmaker Kevin Smith. He works at Jay and Silent Bob's Secret Stash. He stars in AMC's reality TV show "Comic Book Men" and podcasts on SModcast's Tell Em' Steve Dave
description:
Comics

Walter Flanagan has been the artist for several comic runs, most notably the Batman runs he did with friend Kevin Smith. " Cacophony" and " The Widening Gyre" He has also drawn for his friend Bryan Johnson for the comics "Karney" and " War of the Undead". He is the manager of a comic book store owned by Kevin Smith called "Jay and Silent Bob's Secret Stash" located in Red Bank, New Jersey.

Movies

Seeing as how filmmaker Kevin Smith is a very close friend of Flanagan, it's no doubt that he has appeared in some of his movies. In Clerks, he played with 4 different roles. In Mallrats he and friend Bryan Johnson were introduced as the duo Steve-Dave and Fanboy. From then on, they both have played a recurring part in most of Smith's films.

Other

Every week he partakes in 2 podcasts on Kevin Smith SModcast Network. "Tell Em' Steve Dave" on Fridays, and "Highlands: A Peephole History" on Tuesdays.

Comic Book Men

Walt is currently starring on a reality TV show called "Comic Book Men" (2012-) The show is about Walt and some other people working at a comic book shop called Jay and Silent Bob's secret stash. They wheel 'n' deal, and sometimes they go to conventions.
name: Walt Flanagan

deck: Writer and artist of "Atomika", Sal Abbinanti is a blazing talent on the comic book scene in a time when others like him are overlooked for the "hollywood" types, he is open to charity and is one of the creative minds who stll care about comic books.
description: Sal is a very talented comic creator, and is open to charitable ideas, even if considered rebellious. His popular "Atomika" issues, among other work, including his friendship with Alex Ross, have made him a name in the industry, one who still cares about comic books.
name: Sal Abbinanti
